document_title: Rupture of blood vessels in the brain: Signs, causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: vo-mach-mau-nao.json_3_Is a ruptured blood vessel in the brain dangerous?
subsection_content:
According to the Brain Aneurysm Foundation (American Brain Aneurysm Association), about 50% of brain aneurysm ruptures are fatal. Those who survived also encountered serious complications. Of these, 66% of people who lived through a critical brain aneurysm rupture suffered permanent nervous system damage. (4)
Complications that patients with ruptured blood vessels in the brain may face include:
Loss of language, slurred speech, difficulty in communication; Paralysis of arms, legs or all four limbs, paralysis of half the body; Muscle stiffness, difficulty moving arms and legs; Loss of mobility; Swallowing disorders; Collapsed lung, pneumonia; Urinary tract infections; Anxiety, excessive stress, depression...; Severe cases will lead to death or vegetative state
Rupture of blood vessels in the brain leaves serious complications for the patient
